item.title: Modelling of diseases
item.description: I was bored and in a world where doom and gloom were around me, so I decided to model that. A lot of the inspiration for this came from a video I watched by 3Blue1Brown about modelling infectious diseases, like COVID-19. This experiment was a fun trial of CSS grid, which at the time was completely new to me. I also combined two JS libraries here: p5.js for graphics and chart.

item.title: Timeout VC
item.description: For my work on Timeout, I was given an award by my University, signed by the Pro-Vice Chancellor for Education. Here’s another news post by the Engineering Department. I’ve written two blog posts on Timeout, one on its historical origins and another on its technical aspects. I recently wrote a WSGI frontend to interact with the BigBlueButton API called LightBlueTent. This is written in Flask and has a proper Docker development environment.

item.title: Assorted games
item.description: List of games A curated list of the games that made the cut (looking back at my 14-year-old self was tough!) is shown here: Catch! – Can you catch the shapes in time? Grinch Invaders – A shooter game inspired by space invaders Dabble – Like scrabble but now you have to dodge! Simon – Simon says… Dodge – The classic! Magneto – Combining magnets, orbits and fun! Flappy bird – A crude remake A few notes:

item.title: About me
item.description: I’m Matias - an engineering student at Cambridge University, currently in my second year and set to graduate with a Master’s in Engineering. Though I’m “officially” an engineering ugrad, my interests are varied ranging from software development and deployment, Linux sysadmining, embedded systems, cooking and linguistics. What am I studying? I’m an undergraduate student in the Engineering Department at the University of Cambridge. I have recently finished my first year (1A).
